result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan M Fox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (6/3/16) through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office or set up a payment plan within said time.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan M Fox

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
(1:44) Defendant Bryan M Fox in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Court reviews recomm.; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads Guilty to Poss. of THC; stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FV&K and finds Def. guilty of Poss. of THC; State heard; Atty. Wales heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence

* $50 F+C = $383.25 within 60 days
* $200 DNA surcharge and sample

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:28 - Defendant Bryan M Fox in court in person with attorney Scott Alan Wales by phone.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Return date scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from Atty. Wales - telephone appearance by Atty. approved
